resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5055: ARROW-6194: [Java] Make DictionaryEncoder non-static making it easy to extend and reuse
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5055
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6194](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6194).
   As discussed in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4994.
   Current static DictionaryEncoder has some limitation for extension and reuse.
   Slightly change the APIs and migrate static method to object based approach.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

emkornfield commented on pull request #5055: ARROW-6194: [Java] Make DictionaryEncoder non-static making it easy to extend and reuse
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5055#discussion_r312715656
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/dictionary/DictionaryEncoder.java
 ##########
 @@ -31,29 +32,37 @@
  */
 public class DictionaryEncoder {
 
-  // TODO recursively examine fields?
+  private final DictionaryHashTable hashTable;
+  private final Dictionary dictionary;
+  private final BufferAllocator allocator;
+
+  //TODO pass custom hasher.
+
+  /**
+   * Construct an instance.
+   */
+  public DictionaryEncoder(Dictionary dictionary, BufferAllocator allocator) {
+    this.dictionary = dictionary;
+    this.allocator = allocator;
+    hashTable = new DictionaryHashTable(dictionary.getVector());
+    hashTable.ensureBuildTable();
+  }
 
   /**
    * Dictionary encodes a vector with a provided dictionary. The dictionary must contain all values in the vector.
    *
-   * @param vector     vector to encode
-   * @param dictionary dictionary used for encoding
+   * @param vector vector to encode
    * @return dictionary encoded vector
    */
-  public static ValueVector encode(ValueVector vector, Dictionary dictionary) {
 
 Review comment:
   this is a useful utility method, I don't think it should be removed, it can make use of the the instantiated object under the hood.

  */
 public class DictionaryEncoder {
 
-  // TODO recursively examine fields?
+  private final DictionaryHashTable hashTable;
+  private final Dictionary dictionary;
+  private final BufferAllocator allocator;
+
+  //TODO pass custom hasher.
+
+  /**

+    this.dictionary = dictionary;

   Right, thanks for pointing out, added back now. In this way we could make optimization in later versions meanwhile not breaking previous API.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
As discussed in [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4994].

Current static DictionaryEncoder has some limitation for extension and reuse.

Slightly change the APIs and migrate static method to object based approach.
fields.summary: [Java] Add non-static approach in DictionaryEncoder making it easy to extend and reuse
